campaign.story:
It's an upcoming software tool that will let you make your own SNES-compatible games without writing code. Once you create your game on the PC, you can save it onto a cartridge that plays on a real console.
Software and hardware prototypes
Retro Game Builder won't force you to program in complicated 65816 assembly language like it's 1991. Instead, you can construct your game logic with an intuitive graphical interface. And if you happen to be an advanced programmer who wants maximum performance and control, you'll be able to access the assembly code under the hood. 
I started making games back in the 1980s on 8-bit computers, and over the years I've used various game engines, libraries, and frameworks. For the past two decades I've been developing business software, but games have always been my true passion. That's one of the many reasons I'm making Retro Game Builder.
I produce videos for element14 Presents, where I design and build electronics projects. Check out some of my favorite hacks involving retro game consoles:
Retro Game Builder is in the early stages of development. There's a working prototype for the cartridge programmer, and the software is in a pre-alpha version. Here are a few of the things it can do today:
Asset creation, including palettes and tile sets
UI-based logic design (logic flows)
File export for testing in emulators
Ability to save files to cartridge 

For months I've been working in my spare time to prepare for this campaign. Unfortunately, nights and weekends aren't going to be enough to finish development in the reasonably near future. Funding is needed so I can work full-time on the following features:
Advanced tile map editing, including metatiles and large maps
Animation and collision detection
A wide range of pre-built logic nodes
Sound and music
Ability to save games to SRAM
Mode 7 support
Tutorials and demos
Final version of cartridge programmer with improved performance

For rewards that include the software, you'll receive a link to download a digital copy of the program when it's released. Retro Game Builder is a Windows application. For rewards that include cartridges, they will be shipped to an address that you provide. The cartridge programmer shown on this page is a prototype only. Backers will receive an improved final version.
If you choose a reward with beta access, you'll receive a link to download an early preview version of the software when it becomes available.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've done my best to set a realistic funding goal and delivery estimates based on my experience. But things don't always go perfectly to plan. Unforeseen technical challenges could cause development to take longer than expected, and that might affect the delivery dates for rewards. It's also possible that importing parts like chips and PCBs could take longer due to factors beyond my control. Regardless of what happens, I'll be as transparent as possible and share regular updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Doodle World is an all new game for play on the NES! Play as Doodle and help him save his world from the evil King Eraser and his office supply minions.
Run, jump and pounce on enemies as you navigate your way through this colorful side-scroller! 
Pounce on that eraser!
From Paper to Pixels
While trying to come up with a concept for a new NES game, I watched my daughter doodle on notepad paper and the idea for Doodle World was born. Her doodles have been brought to life in this highly stylized NES game. Embracing the limitations of the NES hardware I was able to create an entire game with the look of a hand drawn world on notebook paper.   
From paper to pixel!
In case there was ever any confusion...
Story
The evil King Eraser and his office supply minions had stolen the magical crayon used to create Doodle's amazing world! Play as Doodle and travel across the world to defeat King Eraser and his minions. Along the way you will encounter numerous office supply enemies and eraser bosses.
Explore five amazing worlds!
Find bonus stages full of crayons!
Fight a hastily built robo-eraser!
Gameplay Features
5 Worlds
15 levels of platforming action
5 Exciting boss battles
Innovative "Kids Mode" for younger players 
Doodle World features an innovative "Kids Mode". With "Kids Mode" younger players can enjoy the game with more lives,  less levels, and easier enemies and bosses!
Music
The music and sound design for Doodle World was created by the extremely talented chiptune artist Takumi Grainger!
To hear more of his work, check out his SoundCloud, YouTube, and Twitter!
Demo
Want to try out Doodle World for yourself? Download the latest demo ROM here to play in your favorite NES emulator, I recommend Mesen.
Stretch Goal!
$13,000 - Purchase games and consoles for The Children’s Hospital of San Antonio
We are proud to announce that we are working with The Children’s Hospital of San Antonio to bring games and consoles to patients!
Purchasing Doodle World will help provide games and consoles to children during a very difficult and stressful time in their lives.
 Rewards  
The standard grey cart and the limited edition white cart
Digital Pack of the game will receive:
ROM File
PDF Instruction Booklet
MP3 Soundtrack
Cartridge Pack of the game will also receive:
ROM File
MP3 Soundtrack
PDF Instruction Booklet
Standard Gray Doodle World Cartridge
In fitting with the theme of the game, each boxed copy of Doodle World comes with a pack of four crayons and an instruction manual that doubles as a coloring and activity book!
Boxed Packs of the game will receive:
ROM File
PDF Instruction Booklet
MP3 Soundtrack
Standard Gray Doodle World Cartridge
Standard Box
Coloring Book Manual
Dust Sleeve
Foam Block
Crayons
Limited Edition Packs of the game will receive:
White Doodle World Cartridge
Sticker Sheet
Coloring Book Manual
Standard Box
Dust Sleeve
Foam Block
Crayons
MP3 Soundtrack
PDF Instruction Booklet
ROM File
Special Limited Edition Start Screen
There will only be 50 Limited Edition copies made, so get yours while they last!
All the quality printed materials are being sourced with assistance from Tim at Retrotainment Games. Boards and cart shells are being produced by Infinite NES Lives.
Social Media
Want to learn more or just chat? Follow Doodle World on your favorite platform!
Twitter Facebook
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The programming and extensive play testing for Doodle World is complete and the game is ready to launch, however, in order to produce and release a physical version of the game I am seeking funding via Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
First of all, let us say that we're sorry for the delays. 
We know many of you backed this project because you were interested in the world and what we had to offer, and we admit that we have disappointed many of you. We have made promises about the completion of this project, and regrettably, we have to admit that we overextended. 
2020 was an incredibly unkind year, and 2021 has proven itself to be not much better for us. We've had to redirect and channel our efforts to tiding through several incredibly rough patches, and this unfortunately meant that Pentopia fell on the wayside.

Hey everyone,  
Thanks for checking in with us. We appreciate the feedback and we understand that you guys must be disappointed with the delays. 
We initially planned to release the digital copies together with the physical copies were fulfilled, but things being the way they are around the world, we know how important it is to stay creative and how our art can play a role in inspiring you. 
On our end, we have used these extra months to revisit some of our work on Pentopia, and to polish up aspects of the art and the lore that we felt could be improved. We are excited to share these with you, and are discussing the possibility of releasing several sections of the books in digital format within the next few weeks.

We've been a little on the quiet for the past couple months. We've had a few things in the pipeline like conventions and appearances, but rest assured that CGlas is still cranking out awesome art, and our Kickstarter is still on track. 
Here's a couple things we'd like to share:
1. Official Printer
